name: S1: Ep4/5 "Home Shopping" & "Love is on the Air" Quiz | Television | 10 Questions
tags: Saved By The Bell: The New Class

questions.text: Ep. 4: Where did Scott and Lindsay work?
questions.explanation:
School store.

	Their first sale was two paper clips. The sale was only a few cents, but they earned a commission off each sale. Vicki worked as a news reporter, and Weasel and Megan worked with her.

questions.text: Ep. 4: Mr. Belding approved starting a home shopping channel for Bayside students.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Scott came up with the idea and he and Megan pitched it to Mr. Belding. He approved and said he loved the real home shopping channel. Lindsay served as the product model. Scott hosted the show and Weazel worked as a co-host.

questions.text: Ep. 4: In what subject was the tough midterm the group was unprepared for?
questions.explanation:
History.

	The teacher, Mr. Hammersmith, wanted to teach at Harvard. He was upset that his brilliance was wasted at the high school. The entire Maxx restaurant was studying for his class.

questions.text: Ep. 4: What was Vicki putting into her milkshake at the Maxx?
questions.explanation:
Fish oil.

	Scott decided to use the fish oil to create a "memory potion" to sell on the Bayside shopping channel. At first the drink tasted terrible, then he switched out the actual memory helping items with chocolate sauce.

questions.text: Ep. 4: Who returned to the Maxx as a waiter?
questions.explanation:
James.

	James, who appeared on the original "Saved by the Bell" as a waiter at the Maxx, returned to the show in the fourth episode of the series. He said he had been acting in a movie, but was fired for delivering his lines too loudly. He was playing a librarian in the movie.

questions.text: Ep. 5: What activity did Scott join?
questions.explanation:
Radio station.

	Scott joined the school radio station and joined a show with Weasel where they gave dating advice. "Dr. Luv" gave out the advice to other students at the school. This was all so he could switch into a different study hall and spend more time with the girls of Bayside.

questions.text: Ep. 5: What was the name of Mr. Belding's son?
questions.explanation:
Zack.

	His son was named after Zack Morris during an episode of "Saved by the Bell". That history of the character carried over into the new series. Early in the episode he was asking Tommy D to install a car seat in his vehicle so he could spend more time with little Zack.

questions.text: Ep. 5: Weasel gave advice from a book about what classic TV show?
questions.explanation:
The Brady Bunch.

	Weasel was reading a book about "The Brady Bunch" when he answered a phone call while the actual hosts of the show were out of the studio. He made up a voice and gave advice based on an episode of the show he had been reading about.

questions.text: Ep. 5: Who did Vicki ask out on a date?
questions.explanation:
Scott.

	Vicki thought she got bad advice from Dr. Luv. Scott told her to take his advice and was then surprised when she asked him out. He agreed to go with her in order to protect Dr. Luv's reputation.

questions.text: Ep. 5: Weasel, as Dr. Luv, went on a date with Jenny.
questions.explanation:
True.

	He wore a fake mustache, beard, trench coat, hat and glasses to the theater. When she asked him to take off the extra clothes he ran out to get popcorn. As Dr. Luv he tried to get her to like Weasel, and she laughed at him.
